snippet: Three trusted aides to the North Korean leader Kim Jong-un arrived in South Korea on Saturday to attend the closing ceremony of the Asian Games in a highly unusual trip.
lead_paragraph: Three trusted aides to the North Korean leader Kim Jong-un arrived in South Korea on Saturday to attend the closing ceremony of the Asian Games in a highly unusual trip.
abstract: Three trusted aides to North Korean leader Kim Jong-un arrive in South Korea to attend closing ceremony of Asian Games in a highly unusual trip that might signal easing tensions between countries.

headline.main: In Unusual Trip, North Korean Aides Attend Games in South
headline.print_headline: N. Korea Shows at Games in South

snippet: All 109 people on board were rescued, but the accident, the first notable ferry mishap since a disaster in April, drew attention in the country.
lead_paragraph: All 109 people on board were rescued, but the accident, the first notable ferry mishap since a disaster in April, drew attention in the country.
abstract: All 109 people on board a South Korean tourist boat are rescued after vessel runs onto a submerged rock; accident draws keen attention in country still recovering from ferry accident that claimed 304 lives in April.

headline.main: No Casualties After South Korean Tourist Boat Runs Aground
headline.print_headline: South Korea: Everyone Rescued From a Ferry Accident

snippet: As grieving families continue their demands for a full inquiry into the April disaster, the president’s supporters have started to criticize them.
lead_paragraph: As grieving families continue their demands for a full inquiry into the April disaster, the president’s supporters have started to criticize them.
abstract: Memo from Seoul; grieving families in Seoul, South Korea, continue their demands for a full inquiry into the April ferry disaster in which 250 high school students died, but Pres Park Geun-hye's conservative supporters have started to criticize them; disaster that initially united country now polarizes it.

headline.main: Ferry Disaster That United South Korea Now Polarizes It
headline.print_headline: Ferry Disaster That United South Korea Now Polarizes It

snippet: The deal includes technology transfers that will help the country build advanced combat aircraft of its own.
lead_paragraph: The deal includes technology transfers that will help the country build advanced combat aircraft of its own.

headline.main: South Korea Formally Announces Intent to Buy 40 Lockheed Fighter Jets

snippet: South Korea celebrated a win over rival North Korea at the Asian Games, winning the gold medal in the men’s soccer final, 1-0, in Incheon, South Korea.
lead_paragraph: South Korea celebrated a win over rival North Korea at the Asian Games, winning the gold medal in the men’s soccer final, 1-0, in Incheon, South Korea.
abstract: South Korea defeats North Korea, 1-0, at the Asian Games, winning gold medal in the men's soccer final.

headline.main: South Korea Takes Soccer Gold
headline.print_headline: South Korea Takes Soccer Gold

snippet: A North Korean navy patrol boat crossed the disputed Northern Limit Line, and entered waters controlled by the South.
lead_paragraph: A North Korean navy patrol boat crossed the disputed Northern Limit Line, and entered waters controlled by the South.
abstract: South and North Korean navy patrol boats exchange fire at disputed western sea border, three days after the two rival nations raised hopes for thaw in their long-tense relations by agreeing to resume high-level dialogue.

headline.main: Two Koreas Exchange Fire at Sea Border
headline.print_headline: Two Koreas Exchange Fire at Sea Border

snippet: South Korea has been granted automatic entry into the 2018 Olympic ice hockey tournament in Pyeongchang despite the country’s low ranking in the sport.
lead_paragraph: South Korea has been granted automatic entry into the 2018 Olympic ice hockey tournament in Pyeongchang despite the country’s low ranking in the sport.
abstract: International Ice Hockey Federation grants South Korea's men's and women's national teams automatic entry into the Olympic ice hockey tournaments at the 2018 Olympic games in Pyeongchang.

headline.main: South Korea Is Awarded Berths in 2018 Olympic Tournaments
headline.print_headline: South Korea Is Awarded Berths in 2018 Olympic Tournaments

snippet: A breakthrough appeared to come Saturday, during a meeting between South Korean officials and a delegation from the North visiting for the closing ceremony of the Asian Games.
lead_paragraph: A breakthrough appeared to come Saturday, during a meeting between South Korean officials and a delegation from the North visiting for the closing ceremony of the Asian Games.
abstract: South Korea and North Korea agree to resume high-level talks, raising hopes for a thaw in long-tense relations on divided Korean Peninsula.

headline.main: South and North Korea Agree to New Talks
headline.print_headline: South and North Korea Agree to New Talks

snippet: North Korea does not recognize the disputed sea border where the incident occurred Friday, and its patrol ships have occasionally crossed it.
lead_paragraph: North Korea does not recognize the disputed sea border where the incident occurred Friday, and its patrol ships have occasionally crossed it.
abstract: North Korean patrol boat crosses disputed western sea border with South Korea and retreats after warning shots are fired by South Korean Navy.

headline.main: South Korea Says It Fired Warning Shots at Patrol Boat From North
headline.print_headline: South Korea: Warning Shots Fired

snippet: The court found that Won Sei-hoon, former head of the National Intelligence Service, had violated a law barring the agency from domestic politics.
lead_paragraph: The court found that Won Sei-hoon, former head of the National Intelligence Service, had violated a law barring the agency from domestic politics.
abstract: Former South Korean intelligence chief Won Sei-hoon is sentenced to two and a half years in prison for violating law that bans his spy agency from involvement in domestic politics.

headline.main: Former South Korean Spy Chief Convicted in Online Campaign Against Liberals
headline.print_headline: South Korea: Spy Chief Is Convicted for Effort to Sway Vote on Social Media

snippet: An American was arrested Tuesday night on a river that borders North Korea, the South Korean news media reported on Wednesday.
lead_paragraph: An American was arrested Tuesday night on a river that borders North Korea, the South Korean news media reported on Wednesday.
abstract: American man is arrested by South Korean authorities after attempting to swim to North Korea.

headline.main: South Korea: American Fails in Effort to Swim to North
headline.print_headline: South Korea: American Fails in Effort to Swim to North

snippet: Pyongyang said the 52-year-old man had entered the North through an unidentified third country to escape his economic difficulties in the capitalist South.
lead_paragraph: Pyongyang said the 52-year-old man had entered the North through an unidentified third country to escape his economic difficulties in the capitalist South.
abstract: North Korea returns South Korean defector Kim Sang-geun, who entered the North illegally.

headline.main: North Korea Returns a Defector to the South
headline.print_headline: North Korea: Defector Is Sent Home

snippet: The soldiers apparently suffocated during an exercise meant to prepare them for being taken prisoner by the enemy, a military spokesman said Wednesday.
lead_paragraph: The soldiers apparently suffocated during an exercise meant to prepare them for being taken prisoner by the enemy, a military spokesman said Wednesday.
abstract: Two South Korean soldiers die, apparently by suffocation, during an exercise meant to prepare them for capture by the enemy at base in Jeungpyeong.

headline.main: 2 South Korean Soldiers Die in Anti-Captivity Training
headline.print_headline: South Korea: Soldiers Die in Exercise

snippet: North Korea fired three short-range projectile off its east coast that landed harmlessly in the sea near Japan, South Korean military officials said.
lead_paragraph: North Korea fired three short-range projectile off its east coast that landed harmlessly in the sea near Japan, South Korean military officials said.
abstract: South Korean military says North Korea launched three short-range projectiles off its east coast, apparent test of newly developed tactical missile.

headline.main: North Korea Reported to Test Short-Range Missiles
headline.print_headline: North Korea: Missile Test Reported

snippet: The United States Justice Department has seized $500,000 traced to former President Chun Doo-hwan of South Korea, who was convicted in a South Korean court in 1997 of accepting more than $200 million in bribes while in office from 1980 to 1988.
lead_paragraph: The United States Justice Department has seized $500,000 traced to former President Chun Doo-hwan of South Korea, who was convicted in a South Korean court in 1997 of accepting more than $200 million in bribes while in office from 1980 to 1988.

snippet: The latest move comes with efforts to merge Samsung affiliates gaining speed after the patriarch of group’s controlling family was hospitalized in May.
lead_paragraph: The latest move comes with efforts to merge Samsung affiliates gaining speed after the patriarch of group’s controlling family was hospitalized in May.
abstract: Samsung Group's shipbuilding and engineering arms agree to merge by end of 2014; movie is latest step in restructuring, coming as apparent response to failing health of group's controlling family patriarch, Lee Kun-hee.

headline.print_headline: Samsung Group’s Shipbuilding and Engineering Arms to Merge

snippet: Cultural influence has kept pace with South Korea’s growth.
lead_paragraph: Cultural influence has kept pace with South Korea’s growth.

snippet: The artist Hong Sung-dam lashed out at an elite he considers responsible for a deadly ferry disaster, and has faced censorship he likens to his treatment during years of dictatorship.
lead_paragraph: The artist Hong Sung-dam lashed out at an elite he considers responsible for a deadly ferry disaster, and has faced censorship he likens to his treatment during years of dictatorship.
abstract: South Korean government, in unusual display of censorship, pulls large painting by dissident artist Hong Sung-dam from international art festival; Hong has been outspoken in his opposition to Pres Park Geun-hye's government, echoing widespread criticism of its botched rescue effort following ferry disaster, lax oversight, and resistance to a broad independent investigation.

headline.main: An Artist Is Rebuked for Casting South Korea’s Leader in an Unflattering Light
headline.print_headline: An Artist Is Rebuked for Casting South Korea’s Leader in an Unflattering Light

snippet: Prosecutors indicted a Japanese journalist on charges he defamed South Korea’s president by reporting rumors that she was absent for seven hours during the April ferry disaster because she was with a man.

abstract: South Korea will host the 2018 Olympic Games, but its men’s hockey team may face a daunting road to qualify for the 12-team tournament; there are only 2,100 registered hockey players in South Korea, and although the country has had impressive success at Winter Games, it has never qualified for Olympic hockey.
